items.excerpt:
The Godot Engine is one of the easier game engines to learn but that doesn't mean there aren't some tips and tricks that are hard to know unless you deep-dive into the documentation.

When working as a game developer, every tip and trick to save yourself time and make your life easier counts.  So I briefly scoured the internet to find some great Godot Engine tricks (Godot 3.5 and Godot 4.0) and baked them up in a nice bite-sized video, so you don‚Äôt have to.

üåê StayAtHomeDev Website - https://stayathomedev.com/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=13tips

Support the Channel!

üéÆ StayAtHomeDev Discord Server - https://discord.gg/dmYbvFYQRQ
üíõ Level Up+ Your Support - http://patreon.com/stayathomedev

More Videos!

‚úÖ My Dream Game Devlog Series
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXCN7L7RwJE&list=PLEHvj4yeNfeG_rYcHaHNznViZngQfJ0OB

‚úÖ This Week in Godot (more episodes)

items.excerpt:
A video in which I talk about the benefits of using the Multi-Mesh instance node in Godot 3.5 and why it works. Spoilers for the video, it's using a rendering technique called "batching" or "batching draw calls".

Buy me a coffee? https://ko-fi.com/wattinteractive

00:00 - Start
00:42 - Some Background - Rendering
01:19 - Krita Example
02:33 - Potential Drawbacks
03:11 - Finally talking Godot specifics

Thanks to StreamBeats by Harris Heller for the music.
items.title: Amazing Performance Gains from 1 node in Godot 3.5

items.excerpt:
In this video we do a speed run creating a simple XR game in Godot using a new template we prepared.
This video is specifically targeted at using Godot at game jams.

Timecodes:
00:00 Download requirements
00:35 Install components
00:55 Create project
01:10 Install export templates
01:35 Godot XR template overview
02:20 Create a new level
03:35 Create our toy gun scene
06:00 Create our foam bullet scene
06:50 Spawning or bullet
07:55 Adding a highlight to our toy gun
08:50 Adding our toy gun to our scene
09:10 Creating a target
10:25 First demo
10:35 Adding sound effects
11:20 Final demo

Disclaimer, it probably took about 3 - 4 hours to actually create the game featured in this video. 
The majority of that time was spend putting the environment together.

Links:
- https://godotengine.org/ - Godot Engine website
- https://github.com/GodotVR/godot-xr-template - The template we are using here
- https://kenney.nl/ - Free game assets from Kenney
- https://freesound.org/ - Free sound assets for your game
- https://godotvr.github.io/godot-xr-tools/ - Documentation about XR Tools

Join this channel to get access to perks:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrbLJYzJjDf2p-vJC011lYw/join

Follow me on Mastodon or Twitter for regular updates:
https://mastodon.gamedev.place/web/@mux213
https://twitter.com/mux213
items.title: Creating a Godot XR game in 12 minutes.

items.excerpt:
Lambda functions are small, anonymous functions that can be declared inline rather than via full function declaration. Let's take a quick look at how to write them in Godot 4.

Text version and code snippets: https://shaggydev.com/2023/02/02/godot-4-lambda-functions

Godot docs: https://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/tutorials/scripting/gdscript/gdscript_basics.html#lambda-functions

Corrections:
01:09 This only applies to local variables where the lambda is declared, such as the variable and lambda inside of _ready() in this example. Changes to variables declared at a higher scope are not subject to this, such as moving the variable declaration outside of the _ready() function.
items.title: Godot 4 lambda functions

items.excerpt:
Hello everyone and welcome back to another Godot community spotlight video. If you are new here, welcome. Each week I try to shine a light on people doing things and explaining how to do things in the Godot engine and hopefully play my small part in growing the Godot community. Recently Godot 4 has been trending upwards on Google Search and looking around YouTube for new and interesting videos has proved to be very fruitful. Here are just a few of the videos I found this week:

items.excerpt:
In this Godot 4 tutorial, you will learn how to create a high quality water shader script from scratch and apply it to a single plane mesh.

I go through basic shader setup, albedo, roughness, and metallic settings, and normal map setup and animation.

I also cover more advanced water shader features like vertex noise displacement, depth color, and edge detection.

You will learn some basics about the Godot shading language and have knowledge you can use to create your own Godot shaders in the Godot Engine.

You can also check out the written tutorial here: https://stayathomedev.com/tutorials/single-plane-water-shader/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=description&utm_campaign=tutorials&utm_content=watershader

The tutorial project files are also available to registered users on the StayAtHomeDev website (link below).

Support the Channel!

‚úÖ StayAtHomeDev Website - https://stayathomedev.com/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=watershader

üéÆ StayAtHomeDev Discord Server - https://discord.gg/dmYbvFYQRQ
üíõ Level Up+ Your Support - http://patreon.com/stayathomedev

items.excerpt: This example uses undocumented behaviour of Godot 4's LightmapGI node, which calls get_bake_bmeshes() to fetch meshes on each Node3D (excluding MeshInstance3D). Also I'm using patch which adds texel_scale to LightmapGI node, to shorten the baking time by reducing shadows texture size/quality: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/64908

After finishing my last project, I decided for beta 11 (or beta 12 by the time I finished it), I was going to make an archery game based off archery from Wii sports resort. So, after spending the week working on it, this is what I accomplished.

If you would like to play the game, here's the link for it on itch.
Just note that I was only able to test it on Mac, so things may not run as expected on other platforms.
https://jenjell.itch.io/archery
